result.execSummary:
The defendant Calvin L. Smith Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Cocaine (>5-15g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)2.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).
  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action - for all 3 children.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney B VanCuick.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On ct 1 the court imposes a total sentence of 6 years WSP; 3 years initial confinement w/credit for 103 days served; 3 years extended supervision w/conditions; on ct 2 the court imposes a total sentence of 6 years WSP concurrent to ct 1; 3 years initial confinement w/credit for 103 days served; 3 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $500 DNA surcharge, bond applied to costs, any remainder of bond to be returned to poster.

Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Brenda VanCuick.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  Matter heard with 13CF81.  Witness, Angela W., appears in court - states she never received a subpoena.  Court dismisses the material witness warrant.  DE no longer wishes to continue to trial.  State has provided an offer to the DE.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty to counts 1 & 2; found guilty by the court.  On the motion of the State, count 3 is dismissed & read-in.  Presentence Investigation ordered.  BOND REVOKED.  DE taken into custody.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 9am.
in Limine - filed by Attorney Brenda VanCuick

13CF81 and 15CF393 - Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Brenda VanCuick.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Cases have been joined for trial.  Voir dire and jury selection completed at 11:00 a.m.  13 jurors selected.  Motions in limine heard and decided.  Trial to commence on 2/2/16 at 9:00 a.m.  Material witness warrant to issue for witness Angela W.; bond set at $10,000.00 cash.  Bond continued.

With Atty VanCuick, ADA McNeill, and by approval of the court, the JS of 11/16/15 at 8:30am is rescheduled, as Atty VanCuick has a conference to attend; reset to 12/14/15 at 8:30am; the JSH is rescheduled from 10/29/15 at 1:30pm to 11/30/15 at 1:15pm.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney B VanCuick.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  ADA McNeill's joinder motion; also states there are witnesses that are unavailable for the trial date of 8/18/15.  Atty VanCuick opposes joinder motion.  Court grants joinder motion for cases 15CF393 & 13CF81.  Atty VanCuick requests a Daubert hearing on State's notice of expert for Detective Strelow.  Court finds that a Daubert hearing is not necessary, issue of testimony can be addressed at time of trial.  JS is adjourned from 8/18/15 at 8:30am to 11/16/15 at 8:30am, JSH 10/29/15 at 1:30pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Brenda VanCuick. Clerk LE. Amended criminal complaint filed by State. Plea offer placed on the record by ADA Zapf. Def. rejects offer and proceeds with preliminary hearing. Court takes judicial notice of conditions of bond in 13CF81. KPD Det. Steven Deschler sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. VanCuick. Probable cause found. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 5-26-15 @ 9:00am with 13CF81. Bond continued.
